Noticed_CriminalShapeshifting.synopsis: An NPC comments on a player shapeshifting/disguising/otherwise transforming while that player is wanted or being investigated for a crime. Normally, that player would be ignored for that crime from then on, but due to the NPC witnessing the transformation, they won't be. This dialog should make that clear. It will only trigger for non-GUARD NPCs (guards will arrest/interrogate them on sight).
Noticed_CriminalShapeshifting.how_to_trigger: Commit a crime in a region with a prison (e.g. the DEN)Get arrested and go to prisonTeleport out of prison in front of civilians (e.g. the packing tiefling couple)Shapeshift while they can see you.

Noticed_Smelly.synopsis: An NPC notices another character that smells really bad.

Noticed_Distraction.synopsis: An NPC notices a distraction such as a minor illusion or a cat.

Noticed_Vandalise.synopsis: Non-hostile NPC1 noticed a player damaging an item owned by an NPC (NPC1 or someoneelse). NPC1 is not dealing with this crime (they are not the one initiating combat/calling for help), but they are reacting to it as a bystander.

Investigation_RunFromCriminal.synopsis: A player attacked an NPC from out of sight, and this NPC or another one is fleeing from that attack, looking for cover. This dialog is only played by "cowardly" NPCs: plain CIVILIANs and BEASTs that are not AGGREESIVEBEAST.Note: multiple NPCs will most likely play this dialog at the same time, or shortly after each other. So watch out with sequences, since those will be spread across multiple NPCs and not play in order on one NPC.

Noticed_SummonMoveItem.synopsis: A player summon (which could be anything from a badger to a zombie) moves, uses, lockpicks or disarms an item owned by an NPC.

Help_Vandalise.synopsis: A non-hostile NPC notices a player damaging or destroying an item.

Noticed_Theft.synopsis: Non-hostile NPC1 noticed a player stealing an item owned by an NPC (NPC1 or someoneelse). NPC1 is not dealing with this crime (they are not the one initiating combat/calling for help), but they are reacting to it as a bystander.

WitnessedGuardKilling.synopsis: AD when someone witnesses the killing of a guard.

Noticed_AttackedAnimal.synopsis: Non-hostile NPC1 noticed a player assaulting an animal/beast.

AfterFleeOrHerdMonsterFallback.synopsis: Generic. An NPC flees from a creature (actually wildshaped player).Fallback dialogue for GEB_AD_Herdmonster or GEB_AD_FleeFromMonster in case the monster comes nearby again within 30 seconds after it left the NPC's proximity. They will run away a little while saying this. It can rigger while they are still moving back to their original position after chasing it away. NPC can be adult or child of any species/race/gender. They can be alone or not. NOTE - Anyone with the DRUID or ACT1_DEN_IDOLTHEFT is exempt from this dialogue.

Noticed_SummonVandalise.synopsis: A player summon (which could be anything from a badger to a zombie) damages an item owned by an NPC.

FleeFromMonster.synopsis: Generic. An NPC sees a player shapeshifted into a scary form (wolf, bear, badger, spider, ...) or a scary summon (spider, fire elemenal, ...), and flees from it. The NPC can be a child or adult of any species. They may be alone or with others (some lines plea for help, but are spoken in general as frightened utterances.NOTE - Anyone with the DRUID or ACT1_DEN_IDOLTHEFT is exempt from this dialogue.

AttackHelp.synopsis: In reaction to a crime by a player (e.g. murder or assault), an NPC engages them in combat.

Attack_Assault_Construct.synopsis: An NPC that is tagged as CONSTRUCT (e.g. a golem) was attacked, and in return becomes hostile to the player and engages them in combat.

Noticed_SummonAssault.synopsis: A player summon (which could be anything from a badger to a zombie) attacks an NPC

Investigation_EdgeTowardsCriminal.synopsis: An NPC got attacked from out of sight, and they and/or other NPCs are now investigating in the direction where the attack came from, trying to find the culprit.Note: multiple NPCs will most likely play this dialog at the same time, or shortly after each other. So watch out with sequences, since those will be spread across multiple NPCs and not play in order on one NPC.

Noticed_SummonLootingCorpse.synopsis: An NPC notices a summon looting a corpse, and makes it stop (possibly attacking)

HerdMonster.synopsis: Generic. A brave NPC sees a player shapeshifted into a scary form (wolf, bear, badger, spider, ...) or a scary summon (spider, fire elemenal, ...), and tries to herd it away. Stout NPCs (GUARD, BADASSCIVILIAN, NOT_MESSING_AROUND)

CannotPickpocket.synopsis: A player tries to pickpocket a character that has a tag indicating it cannot be pickpocketed (like BEAST, ELEMENTAL, SUMMON, ...)

WaitingForGuards_CriminalRunsAway.synopsis: An NPC called for guards after a player committed a crime, and the guards are on their way. The player has moved further away from the NPC (or out of sight) since the NPC called for guards.

WarnFriendlyFire.synopsis: A player hit a neutral NPC while the NPC was in combat. Different versions for first, second and third time this dialog triggers (after the third time, the NPC becomes hospital).This dialog plays with a 40% chance when hitting a neutral during combat

Noticed_KilledAnimal.synopsis: Non-hostile NPC1 noticed a player killing an animal/beast.

Noticed_Assault.synopsis: Non-hostile NPC1 noticed a player assaulting non-hostile NPC2. NPC1 is not dealing with this crime (they are not the one initiating combat/calling for help), but they are reacting to it as a bystander.

Approached.synopsis: An NPC has approached a distraction such as a minor illusion.

Help_Assault.synopsis: A non-hostile civilian has been attacked by a player and is calling for help

Noticed_Pickpocket.synopsis: An NPC notices they have been pickpocketed

AttackedGuardInCombat.synopsis: Most important message: if the player kills this NPC and there are witnesses that survive the combat, the player will be attacked by sight by guards in this region afterwards.Summary: The player attacked a guard during combat in a particular region (the Grove, Moonrise Towers, and eventually also the Goblin Camp, Haven, Wyrm's Crossing, Baldur's Gate proper). When doing so, the guard will play this AD to warn the player that killing them will result in them getting known as a "guard killer", and such players get attacked on sight by other guards in the same region.
AttackedGuardInCombat.how_to_trigger: Go the Grove in WLD_Main_A (206; 25; 555)"roll horrible" in recon. Attack Guex (near the training the tiefling kids). Then attack him again during combat. He will say this AD regularly when you attck him during the combat.

WaitingForGuards_Timeout.synopsis: An NPC called for (remote/out-of-sight) guards, one was found and sent on their way by script, but they didn't arrive (or not in time at least).

Investigation.synopsis: An NPC heard a crime but did not see it happen, or they came up on a crime scene (like a dead body, or an item that's missing because it was stolen), and start "investigating": walking around, looking for "clues" and for people to interrogate about the cirme.

Noticed_EscapedPrison.synopsis: NPC notices a prisoner is missing.

MusicalPerformance_Good.synopsis: |A player is playing an instrument with proficiency. NPCs watch/listen to them play, and appreciate it.Played by multiple NPCs and several times in a row (as long as the player keeps playing), so provide sufficient alternative nodes.Can be spoken by all NPCs tagged HUMANOID|
MusicalPerformance_Good.how_to_trigger: Have proficiency in Performance and play an instrument near some NPCs.

WitnessedGuardKilling_Combat.synopsis: Most important message: if the player leaves this NPC alive (e.g. flees from combat), the player will be attacked by sight by guards in this region from then on (because the NPC will report them to the other guards).Summary: The player killed a guard during combat in a particular region (the Grove, Moonrise Towers, and eventually also the Goblin Camp, Haven, Wyrm's Crossing, Baldur's Gate proper). While that combat is ongoing, other allied NPCs in the combat regular play ADs at the start of their turn to warn the player that they will inform the other guards about this fact if they survive the combat (if they do survice, they will run out of sight and afterwards every other allied guard in the region will attack the player on sight).
WitnessedGuardKilling_Combat.how_to_trigger: Go the Grove in WLD_Main_A (206; 25; 555)Attack Guex (near the training the tiefling kids)Kill him in combatThis AD should play occasionally on other NPCs in the combat when attacking

KeepingAnEyeOut.synopsis: |After having warned/confronted a party member about a crime, the NPC keeps looking at them for a while and occasionally triggers this AD before going back about their own business.|

Attack_GuardKiller.synopsis: An NPC is attacking a player for killing a guard. In this case, the player is currently not in the party (i.e., they're an origin that has since been dismissed) -> AD rather than interactive dialog, since we can't have interactive dialogs between two NPCs.

Noticed_Murder.synopsis: Non-hostile NPC1 noticed a player killing non-hostile NPC2. NPC1 is not dealing with this crime (they are not the one initiating combat/calling for help), but they are reacting to it as a bystander.

Investigation_AttackFallback.synopsis: An NPC noticed a criminal that they wish to confront during their investigation of a crime, but are unable to reach them (pathfinding is blocked). The fallback for this particular crime is to attack the criminal in that case, and when doing so they speak this dialog.

Noticed_Sneaking.synopsis: An NPC notices a player that was sneaking.

Noticed_Polymorphed.synopsis: Non-hostile NPC1 noticed a player polymorphing non-hostile NPC2 into something like a chicken.

GoblinKidFollowCritter.synopsis: Generic. Goblin kid following a cute critter while another goblin kid is throwing rocks at it.

DealWithCrime.synopsis: An NPC tried to call for help after being confronted with a crime, but no help came, and they decide to react to the crime themselves (usually by attacking the criminal).

PickingUpItem.synopsis: A player moved an item, and the NPC is going to pick it up (they won't put it back in its original place, it will stay in their inventory).

GoblinKidCritterGiveUp.synopsis: Generic. Goblin didn't manage to kill the shapeshifted player or summon (small, cute animal) after throwing a bunch of rocks at them, and gives up.Also used after throwing rocks at a player that plays/performs badly using a bardic instrument.

MusicalPerformance_Bad.synopsis: |NPCs react to a player playing their instrument badly (failed perform check).|
MusicalPerformance_Bad.how_to_trigger: 1. Play a non-bard class2. Equip an instrument3. roll horrible4. Play the instrument with some humanoid or BEAST NPCs nearby

Attack.synopsis: An NPC is attacking a player for assaulting someone (that NPC, or another), or murdering someone.

GuardNPCInterrogation.synopsis: An NPC was confronted with a crime, and called for help. A guard, who did not witness the crime, arrived and starts "interrogating" the NPC about what happened.

Noticed_AnimalAttackedAnimal.synopsis: An animal notices a player or summon attacking another animal.

AssaultZeroDamage.synopsis: An non-hostile NPC reacts to a player (not a summon) "attacking" them out of combat, but doing no damage at all, e.g. through a critical miss. Note: this may also be because of beneficial action, like throwing a healing potion (which is the main reason we added this). Unfortunately, we can't differentiate between the two.
AssaultZeroDamage.how_to_trigger: Throw a healing potion onto an NPC

Help_Thief.synopsis: A non-hostile civilian reacts to theft-related crimes (including being pickpocketed).

WaitingForGuards.synopsis: An NPC called for guards after a player committed a crime, and the guards are on their way. The NPC can see the player

CallForHelp.synopsis: An NPC witnessed a crime (or was a victim of a crime), and is calling for others to help them.

KidCritter.synopsis: Generic, A kid (goblin or non-goblin) sees a cute animal summon, or player shapeshifted into a cute animal.If a goblin, they will play this AD when throwing rocks at it.If a non-goblin, they will just move to it.

Noticed_CriminalShapeshifting_0.speaker: GROUP_Civilians
Noticed_CriminalShapeshifting_0.text: I can see right through that disguise, criminal!
Noticed_CriminalShapeshifting_0.context: NodeContext: Generic crime dialogue - not to be recorded

Noticed_Smelly_0.speaker: GROUP_Animals, GROUP_Bugbear, GROUP_Constructs, GROUP_Daisy, GROUP_Demons, GROUP_Desire, GROUP_Dragons, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Gnolls, GROUP_Gnomes, GROUP_Goblins, GROUP_HalfElves, GROUP_Halflings, GROUP_Hobgoblin, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Ogres, GROUP_Origins, GROUP_SmartUndead, GROUP_Tiefling, GROUP_Trolls

Noticed_Theft_1.speaker: GROUP_Animals, GROUP_Bugbear, GROUP_Constructs, GROUP_Daisy, GROUP_Demons, GROUP_Desire, GROUP_Dragons, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Gnolls, GROUP_Gnomes, GROUP_Goblins, GROUP_HalfElves, GROUP_Halflings, GROUP_Hobgoblin, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Ogres, GROUP_Origins, GROUP_SmartUndead, GROUP_Tiefling, GROUP_Trolls
Noticed_Theft_1.text: What? There's a thief on the loose!

Noticed_SummonVandalise_0.speaker: GROUP_Animals, GROUP_Bugbear, GROUP_Constructs, GROUP_Daisy, GROUP_Demons, GROUP_Desire, GROUP_Dragons, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Gnolls, GROUP_Gnomes, GROUP_Goblins, GROUP_HalfElves, GROUP_Halflings, GROUP_Hobgoblin, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Ogres, GROUP_Origins, GROUP_SmartUndead, GROUP_Tiefling, GROUP_Trolls

WarnFriendlyFire_2.context: NodeContext: Next time you attack this NPC in combat he will turn hostile. Keep in mind that the player might not have gotten any prior AD about assault since there's a random chance on it
